actions.committee: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries.
Reported to House from the Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries with amendment, H. Rept. 95-1527.
Measure called up under motion to suspend rules and pass in House.
Measure laid on table in House, S. 415 passed in lieu.

official_title: A bill to amend the Anadromous Fish Conservation Act to include fish in Lake Champlain that ascend streams to spawn.

summary.text: (Reported to House from the Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries with amendment, H. Rept. 95-1527) Amends the Anadromous Fish Conservation Act to include within the conservation, development, and enhancement programs of the Act, fish in Lake Champlain which ascend streans to spawn. Requires the Secretaries of the Interior or Commerce to limit or prohibit commercial fishing for such species on lands or waters in a State under their respective jurisdiction, whenever such State, for conservation purposes, prohibits or limits commercial fishing for anadromous species in such State. Stipulates that such prohibitions shall not apply to Indian commercial fishing rights guaranteed by treaty.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Anadromous Fish Conservation Act to include fish in Lake Champlain that ascend streams to spawn.
